member.name: WS_MESSAGE_STATE
member.summary: The different states that a message can be in.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_STATE.WS_MESSAGE_STATE_EMPTY
member.summary: The initial state after a message has been created. In this state, there is no content in the message, and neither the header nor the body can be accessed.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_STATE.WS_MESSAGE_STATE_INITIALIZED
member.summary: The message headers have been initialized, and can be accessed, but the body cannot be accessed. This state is used to build up all the headers prior to writing/sending them.

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_STATE.WS_MESSAGE_STATE_READING
member.summary: The body of the message is being read, for example when a message is received. In this state, the headers can be accessed, and the body can be read (see or).

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_STATE.WS_MESSAGE_STATE_WRITING
member.summary: The body of the message is being written, for example when a message is being sent. In this state, the headers can be accessed, and the body can be written (see or).

member.name: WS_MESSAGE_STATE.WS_MESSAGE_STATE_DONE
member.summary: The message body has been read or written (the end of the body has been read or written). The headers can still be accessed.
